basics.name: Sebastiano Monti
basics.label: Master of Science in Physics of Data
basics.summary: I am a graduate student interested in the intersection between physics and artificial intelligence.

work.name: Ipazia spa
work.summary: I research and develop new LLM-based agentic architectures to solve complex reasoning tasks, leveraging features such as sparse communication structures and diverse roles.

courses: Management and Analysis of Physics Datasets

publications.name: Deep Convolutional Q-Learning for Traffic Lights Optimization in Smart Cities
publications.summary: A deep reinforcement learning model that uses an image-like representation of the state to achieve autonomous traffic lights control at an intersection in a simulated environment. Results show that this approach reduces average waiting times and queue lengths compared to several baselines, such as a multi-layer perceptron architecture and four non-parametric models.

projects.name: Bone Age Prediction Using CNNs and Visual Attention - Team Project
highlights: Design and comparison of different convolutional neural network architectures for the task of bone age prediction from X-ray images.
Best performing model obtained an accuracy of 94% over the test set.

projects.name: Multi Track Music Generation Using GANs - Team Project
highlights: Realization of a generative adversarial network for realistic sounding single and multi track music generation, both from scratch and conditioned on a previous sample.
Implementation of metrics for a quantitative assessment of generated samples.

projects.name: K-Means Algorithms: Dask Implementation - Team Project
highlights: Development of a parallel version of the k-means clustering algorithm using Dask on a cluster of 3 virtual machines.
Test of the algorithm on a dataset and benchmark of cluster's parameters.

projects.name: Bayesian Analysis of ARPAV Time Series - Team Project
highlights: Analysis of temperature and precipitation data collected in a region of Italy.
Hypothesis tests confirmed that temperatures increase linearly, assuming a 5% level of significance and the average increase amounts in 0.26Â°C every 4 years.
ARIMA was applied on precipitation data to make a forecast and linear regression on most intense events reports an increasing trend.
Distributed masks to the community during the early stage of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic.
Attended first aid and firefighting courses.
